text: is a Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kawamura was born in Niigata on May 17, 1989. She played for her local club Albirex Niigata from 2004 to 2012. She moved to JEF United Chiba in 2013 and Vegalta Sendai in 2014. She was selected Best Eleven in 2015 and 2016. In 2017, she returned to Albirex Niigata. In April 2017, she moved to North Carolina Courage. However she could not play many matches for injure. In 2019, she returned to Albirex Niigata again. On January 13, 2010, Kawamura debuted for the Japan national team against Denmark. She was a member of Japan for 2014 Asian Cup and 2015 World Cup. Japan won the championship at 2014 Asian Cup and 2nd place at 2015 World Cup. She played 32 games and scored 2 goals for Japan until 2017. ==Statistics== List of match in 2010, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2010 2 0 2011 0 0 2012 0 0 2013 2 0 2014 7 1 2015 10 1 2016 8 0 2017 3 0 Total 32 2 ==References== ==Other websites== * *Japan Football Association Category:1989 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Niigata Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Albirex Niigata Ladies players Category:JEF United Chiba Ladies players Category:Mynavi Sendai Ladies players Category:2015 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:2014 AFC Women's Asian Cup players Category:AFC Women's Asian Cup-winning players
title: Yuri Kawamura
